articles.title: Art Performance Given by Company Soldiers
articles.content:
Art Performance Given by Company Soldiers

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- An art performance is being given by company soldiers who proved successful at the 35th servicepersons' art festival of the Korean People's Army at the People's Palace of Culture here before a capacity audience. 
					
					On November 7, the performance was appreciated by Premier Choe Yong Rim and other senior officials of the state, officials of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea and creators, artistes, journalists and pressmen in the fields of culture and art and media.
					
					Put on the stage were colorful numbers of diverse genres  of diverse genres including poem recital "Recollecting General's Jeep", harmonica solo "The Kitchen Wagon Runs," one-man show "Decorum and Morals of Soldier", dialogic poem "General and Our Snow Flower Company" and real story "Care of Glorifying Feats".
					
					The performers vividly showed the militant stamina and heroic spirit of the Korean People's Army.
					
					Seeing simple and true performance, the audience more keenly felt what is the true nature of the KPA firmly rallied around leader Kim Jong Il in feelings and will.
					
					The performance was acclaimed by the audience.

articles.title: DPRK Gov't Pays Deep Care to Disabled
articles.content:
DPRK Gov't Pays Deep Care to Disabled

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- The Government of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea pays deep care to the disabled to improve their living conditions, said Kim Mun Chol, vice-chairman of the C.C., the Korean Federation for the Protection of the Disabled.
					
					Speaking to KCNA on the occasion of the International Day of Persons with Disabilities (December 3), he said:
					
					The government has done a lot of work for helping them recover their mental and physical function and raising their status in society.
					
					Their sanatoriums have been reconstructed or facelifted and hospitals reinforced with up-to-date medical apparatuses for them.
					
					The government has increased investment in producing quality prosthetic appliances and upgrading educational facilities for the disabled.
					
					It also pays deep concern to their sports and cultural activities.
					
					Some days ago, a table-tennis tournament was held in Pyongyang Indoor Stadium between some 70 disabled people and other citizens.
					
					The tournament served as an important occasion in raising public concern for the disabled.
					
					The federation plans to operate training courses of skilled workers to help them enjoy their working life.

articles.title: New Song Encourages Korean People in Construction Projects
articles.content:
New Song Encourages Korean People in Construction Projects

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- A new song was created in the DPRK recently. The song was written by Yun Tu Gun and composed by U Jong Hui.
					
					The song is themed "Let Us Be Responsible for Thousand Years and Guarantee for Ten Thousand Years!" It is a slogan of the solider-builders of the Huichon Power Station.
					
					The song has become increasingly popular in the country. 
					
					It calls for building edifices in a qualitative way with a high ideal and noble view of future. 
					
					The first stanza of the song gives a vivid representation of the country seething with gigantic construction projects. 
					
					The second stanza mirrors servicepersons and civilians devoting their patriotic effort to building edifices throughout the country. 
					
					The third stanza says the coming generations will remember patriots who lived for tomorrow. 
					
					Encouraged by the song, the DPRK people are performing feats in building edifices symbolic of the Songun (military-first) era under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: University Teachers Contribute to Updating Industrial Establishments
articles.content:
University Teachers Contribute to Updating Industrial Establishments

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Chaek University of Technology has applied more than 200 new cutting-edge technologies to 170 industrial establishments in the country over the past three years.
					
					The university has rendered technological assistance to the updating of production processes and management of the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex, Rakwon Machine Complex, Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex, Sunchon Area Youth Coal Mining Complex and many other major industrial establishments. 
					
					Its teachers have successfully made scientific researches for speeding up the country's major projects, including the Huichon Power Station, in a qualitative way. 
					
					They have also contributed to updating light industry factories and developing new products.
					
					They helped the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm modernize the dried apple slice production process and the Tudan Duck Farm set up an integrated computer-controlling production system and put its production processes on a sterilized basis. 
					
					The Pyongyang Flour-processing Factory, Pyongyang Hosiery Factory, Kanggye Koryo Medicine Factory and Sinuiju Chicken Farm also benefit from technical inventions made by teachers of the university.

articles.title: New Flats Built in Phyongsong City of DPRK
articles.content:
New Flats Built in Phyongsong City of DPRK

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- New apartment houses for more than 540 families have been built in Phyongsong City, South Phyongan Province of the country.
					
					14 blocks of 5- or 7-storeyed apartment houses were built in a little more than one year to form a wonderful residential district.
					
					Moving into new houses is going on now.
					
					Leading officials of provincial party and power organs congratulated citizens on their moving to new houses.
					
					It is one of the socialist policies in the DPRK for the state to provide the people with houses free of charge.
					
					Taking part in the construction of those houses were institutions at different levels and industrial establishments in the province. They included the Rural Economy Committee, People's Security Department and Information and Communications Bureau of the province and the Phyongsong City People's Committee.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Korean Nation-First Spirit
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Korean Nation-First Spirit

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- The Korean nation-first spirit is the mental source for realizing independence of the nation, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a bylined article.
					
					The steadfast consciousness of national independence and high national self-respect are a mental mainstay to be kept by all Koreans in realizing the national reunification, the article says, and goes on: 
					
					The Koreans have always and ardently loved their country and waged a vigorous struggle to defend independence of the country and the nation.
					
					When all of them are firmly armed with the Korean nation-first spirit, their independent spirit will grow stronger and their zeal to defend the dignity and sovereignty of the nation will remarkably rise.
					
					The division of the nation, which started in the middle of the last century, has lasted for centuries. This tragic reality calls upon all Koreans to give full play to the nation-first spirit and conduct more dynamically the struggle for realizing independence of the nation.
					
					The Korean nation itself is directly responsible for independent reunification, peace and prosperity, and no one can act for the Korean nation in the struggle for national reunification and prosperity.
					
					Our nation-first spirit encourages the Koreans, divided into the north and the south by foreign forces, to have national consciousness and steadfastly preserve the tradition of unity. 
					
					All Koreans should keep the strong national self-respect and firm resolution to carve out the brilliant history of the homogeneous nation and build a dignified and prosperous, reunified country by themselves. Only then, is it quite possible to solve any problem arising in realizing the country's reunification.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Hits at U.S. Scheme for Triangular Military Alliance
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Hits at U.S. Scheme for Triangular Military Alliance

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- During his recent junkets to south Korea and some Asian countries, the U.S. secretary of Defense told that there would be no reduction of U.S. troops in south Korea despite the cuts in military spending. He also said that the United States would keep its commitment to strengthening the U.S.-south Korea alliance and preventing "north Korea's attack".
					
					In the wake of his statement, the commander of the U.S. forces in Japan, the U.S. ambassador to it and others talked nonsense that the U.S. forces would continue their engagement in Japan despite the drastic cuts in military expenditure and that the U.S.-Japan alliance plays an important role in the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					Commenting on the facts, Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a bylined commentary:
					
					The U.S. tries to keep south Korea and Japan under its control though it is at serious crisis. This shows its criminal intention to perpetuate the U.S. military presence in the Asia-Pacific region and beef up armed forces so as to maintain and strengthen its military domination.
					
					The U.S. gives top priority to strengthening the military alliance with Japan and south Korea in its forward-deploying diplomacy for realizing the Asia-Pacific strategy.
					
					By rounding off the triangular military alliance at an early date the U.S. seeks to produce an Asian-type NATO stronger in nature of aggression and interference capacity than any other military nexus.
					
					The spearhead of main attack by this alliance is directed against the DPRK and its surrounding countries.
					
					The U.S. is working to test the efficiency of the alliance in the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Authorities' Suppression of Koreans in Japan Censured
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Authorities' Suppression of Koreans in Japan Censured

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- The executive committee made up of the Federation of Koreans in Japan for Democracy and Reunification (Hanthongryon) and the National Network of South Korea-Japan People's Solidarity held a joint meeting in Tokyo on December 2 to accuse the puppet authorities of their human rights abuses against Koreans in Japan.
					
					Son Hyong Gun, president of Hanthongryon, addressing the meeting, referred to the tougher crackdown of Koreans by the south Korean consulate in Japan such as rejection of passport issuance for the democratic Koreans and their organizations in Japan.
					
					They will intensify the legitimate actions against the clampdown, he said, calling on all the compatriots to join them.
					
					A letter of protest was read out.
					
					It revealed that the south Korean authorities brand Hanthongryon    as an "anti-state organization" to force its members to secede from it with the issuance of passport as a bait.
					
					The south Korean authorities' oppression is their desperate last-ditch efforts to realize the ambition for remaining in power, it said, adding:
					
					Unpardonable are the present south Korean authorities which are nothing different from the successive military dictatorial regimes in their suppression of people.
					
					The protest letter urged the south Korean authorities to immediately stop the oppression of the Koreans' organizations in Japan.

articles.title: S. Korea: Authorities' Sycophancy toward U.S. Protested
articles.content:
S. Korea: Authorities' Sycophancy toward U.S. Protested

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- Members of civic and social organizations and citizens of south Korea held a rally against the U.S.-south Korea "Free Trade Agreement" in Taegu on Saturday.
					
					Ralliers denounced the authorities for getting hell-bent on the conclusion of humiliating FTA, obsessed by pro-Americanism. 
					
					They burnt the "Grand National Party" in effigy and a picture of the chief executive and heaped curses on the group of traitors going against the public opinion.
					
					This burning ceremony is an eruption of wrath at the present "government", they said, warning that the authorities would face bitterer curse if they do not lend their ears to the public voice.

articles.title: Nov. Issue of Bulletin "Thongil" Off Press
articles.content:
Nov. Issue of Bulletin "Thongil" Off Press

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- The International United Confederation of Koreans issued the November issue of bulletin "Thongil".
					
					The bulletin devoted much space to the news of leader Kim Jong Il inspecting Unit 813 of the Korean People's Army Air Force and enjoying the performance given by an art group under the command of KPA Unit 6556.
					
					It carried a report of the KPA Supreme Command and information bulletin No. 987 issued by the Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea denouncing the reckless moves of the south Korean military warmongers for staging large-scale war maneuvers against the DPRK on five islands in the West Sea of Korea and in its surrounding waters one year after the Yonphyong Island shelling incident. 
					
					It also dealt with a book-releasing ceremony and a seminar held in Pyongyang to mark the centenary of birth of dancer Choe Sung Hui.
					
					The bulletin introduced an article written by Vorontsov, chief of Section for Korea of the Institute of Oriental Studies of the Russian Academy of Sciences, saying that the resumption of the six party talks has been delayed due to the U.S. and south Korean authorities who escalated military tensions despite their lip-service for dialogue.

articles.title: Exploits of Kim Jong Il Lauded by Uruguayan and Russian Papers
articles.content:
Exploits of Kim Jong Il Lauded by Uruguayan and Russian Papers

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- Uruguayan and Russian newspapers carried special write-ups to mark the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero.
					
					The Uruguayan paper La Juventud on Nov. 29 edited an article "KPA Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il, defender of socialism" illustrated with his photo.
					
					The paper praised feats performed by Kim Jong Il in putting the country's defence capability on the highest level and reliably defending socialism.
					
					He ushered in a new era of building a thriving socialist nation, it said, stressing that the credit for signal achievements made in the DPRK goes to his plan and energetic guidance.
					
					The Russian paper Serp I Molot carried in its 12th issue an article titled "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea".
					
					The paper tells about the fact that Kim Jong Il has been wisely leading the struggle of the Korean people to open the gate to a thriving nation with his Songun politics.

articles.title: Serious Electricity Issue in World
articles.content:
Serious Electricity Issue in World

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- About 1 440 000 000 people are living in the areas with no electricity at present worldwide, according to the recent report by the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development.

articles.title: China Produces Over 571 Million Tonnes of Grain
articles.content:
China Produces Over 571 Million Tonnes of Grain

					Beijing, December 6 (KCNA) -- This year's total grain output of China is 571.21 million tonnes.
					
					The State Statistical Bureau of China made the announcement on Friday.

articles.title: China Intensifies Rural Poverty Relief Campaign
articles.content:
China Intensifies Rural Poverty Relief Campaign

					Beijing, December 6 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Communist Party and the State Council of China recently issued a notice on the outline of a drive to relieve rural poverty.
					
					The notice stressed the need for party committees and governments at different levels to recognize the urgency of this drive and strengthen their guidance over it and wage a new offensive to relieve poverty with high sense of responsibility.
					
					It called for wide and in-depth publicity to create good atmosphere in which the whole party and society pay attention and give support to the rural poverty relief campaign.

articles.title: Chinese President Hails Inauguration of CLACS
articles.content:
Chinese President Hails Inauguration of CLACS

					Beijing, December 6 (KCNA) -- China's President Hu Jintao Friday sent messages to Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez Frias and Chilean President Sebastian Pinera Echenique, congratulating them on the inauguration of the Community of Latin American and Caribbean States (CLACS.)
					
					In the messages Hu said the establishment of CLACS serves as a landmark in the regional integration process and makes an important contribution to strengthening the regional unity and cooperation and jointly coping with worldwide challenges. 
					
					China will boost dialogue, exchange and cooperation with CLACS and other countries of the region, striving to establish and develop a comprehensive cooperation partnership based on equality and reciprocity, he added.

articles.title: Chinese Army to Elect Representatives to CPC Congress
articles.content:
Chinese Army to Elect Representatives to CPC Congress

					Beijing, December 6 (KCNA) -- The General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army recently issued a notice related to elections of army representatives to the 18th Congress of the Communist Party of China (CPC). 
					
					The notice gives requirements concerning qualification of representatives and elections.

articles.title: Chinese Official Calls for Rapidly Developing Culture
articles.content:
Chinese Official Calls for Rapidly Developing Culture

					Beijing, December 6 (KCNA) -- The head of the Publicity Department of the C.C., the Communist Party of China called for developing culture successfully and rapidly. 
					
					During his recent inspection tour of Jiangsu Province, Liu Yunshan said scientific development is a subject of the country's economic and cultural development. 
					
					Liu underscored the need to meet new public need for cultural life and take a way of scientific development in all aspects of cultural construction.

articles.title: Housing Construction in China's Province
articles.content:
Housing Construction in China's Province

					Beijing, December 6 (KCNA) -- China's Hebei Province is directing much effort to solving the issue of dwelling houses.
					
					The province plans to construct a total of 2 380 000 dwelling houses during the 12th five-year plan.

articles.title: Russia Rejects Western Assertion
articles.content:
Russia Rejects Western Assertion

					Moscow, December 6 (KCNA) -- An official of the Russian Foreign Ministry, addressing a recent international meeting, resolutely rejected the assertion of Western politicians that the NATO should become "world police".
					
					Some Western politicians seek to solve the world political issues only by military means, he charged.
					
					Reliance on military power is not an effective way but will hinder dialogue and aggravate internal antagonism in this or that country, he said.

articles.title: Russian Official Censures U.S. MD Plan
articles.content:
Russian Official Censures U.S. MD Plan

					Moscow, December 6 (KCNA) -- The executive director of the Russkiy Mir Foundation of Russia said the U.S. missile defense system (MD) poses threat to not only Russia but China.  
					
					Speaking at a Russia-China meeting on cooperation held in Moscow on Thursday and Friday, the executive director disclosed that some U.S. military and political plans like the national security plan and nuclear strategy require armed forces to prepare for two great wars and several limited wars, keeping Russia and China in view. 
					
					The U.S. MD plan gives rise to many problems to China, too, the official added.

articles.title: Russia, China Discuss Bilateral Cooperation
articles.content:
Russia, China Discuss Bilateral Cooperation

					Moscow, December 6 (KCNA) -- A Russia-China meeting was held in Moscow on Thursday and Friday.
					
					The two nations discussed developing bilateral cooperation within the scope of BRICS and the Shanghai Cooperation Organization and agreed to have such a meeting in a regular way.
					
					Next meeting will be held in Beijing in spring of 2012.

articles.title: Aerospace Defence Army Organized in Russia
articles.content:
Aerospace Defence Army Organized in Russia

					Moscow, December 6 (KCNA) -- The Aerospace Defence Army of Russia was recently organized on the order of Russian President Dmitri Medvedev.
					
					Its mission is reportedly to beat back any missile attack from the enemies and carry out air defence duty.
					
					The commanding post of the defence army on Dec. 1 went on the first combat duty to operate the early warning system on missile attack, anti-missile system and anti-air raid system and control space.

articles.title: Russia Ready to Cope with Another World Economic Crisis: Official
articles.content:
Russia Ready to Cope with Another World Economic Crisis: Official

					Moscow, December 6 (KCNA) -- A senior Russian official said the country's economy has been maintained in a stable way though many other nations are suffering from worldwide economic crisis.  
					
					Speaking at a meeting held in Sankt-Peterburg recently, Sergei Narishkin, head of the Russian Federation Presidential Administration, said that even though another world economic crisis comes, the country is ready to cope with it.

articles.title: Iran Warns U.S., West of Sanctions: Majlis
articles.content:
Iran Warns U.S., West of Sanctions: Majlis

					Tehran, December 6 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the Economic Committee of the Iranian Majlis on Dec. 3 warned the U.S. and West of the sanctions.
					
					If the U.S. and West apply sanctions on the energy field of Iran, the world oil price will rise drastically, he said, adding that if then, the U.S. and West will pay fabulous amount of funds to meet their need for energy.
					
					The sanctions will have no influence on the economic activities of Iran and will end in failure, he noted, stressing that Iran will become the final victor in showdown with the U.S. and West.

articles.title: Iran Shoots Down U.S. Forces' Unmanned Plane
articles.content:
Iran Shoots Down U.S. Forces' Unmanned Plane

					Tehran, December 6 (KCNA) -- The Iranian Army shot down a U.S. forces' unmanned plane.
					
					A unit for electronic warfare of the Iranian Army shot down Stealth unmanned plane of the U.S. forces which invaded the territorial airspace of the eastern region, a high-ranking officer of the Iranian Army said on Dec. 4.
					
					It is said that the plane was captured without damage.

articles.title: Mongolia Aims to Continue Fight against AIDS
articles.content:
Mongolia Aims to Continue Fight against AIDS

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- Mongolia is striving to maintain a low prevalence of the AIDS epidemic.
					
					According to a National Strategy Plan for 2010-2015, Mongolia will strive to maintain its current low HIV-prevalence rate of below 5 percent in the most-at-risk population.
					
					The government has launched a variety of programs and tasked the National Committee on AIDS to coordinate all organizations in fighting the epidemic.

articles.title: India Not Interested in Trilateral Security Agreement with U.S., Australia
articles.content:
India Not Interested in Trilateral Security Agreement with U.S., Australia

					New Delhi, December 6 (KCNA) -- India Thursday said it is not interested in a trilateral security agreement with the United States and Australia, as was suggested by Australian foreign minister Kevin Rudd, the Indian external affairs ministry's spokesperson said.

articles.title: Indonesia to Build Nuclear Power Plant
articles.content:
Indonesia to Build Nuclear Power Plant

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- The Indonesian government is planning the first nuclear power plant. 
					
					According to the plan, it will be built on Bangka Island and its generating capacity will amount to 10,000 megawatt. 
					
					Construction on the nuclear power plant is expected to commence in 2015 and full operation is scheduled in 2030.

articles.title: Gamalama Volcano Erupts in Indonesia
articles.content:
Gamalama Volcano Erupts in Indonesia

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- Gamalama volcano in north Maluku province, Indonesia, erupted on Sunday night, spewing ashes into the air.
					
					Emergent measures were taken to let the local residents evacuate.

articles.title: Summit of Community of Latin American and Caribbean States Held
articles.content:
Summit of Community of Latin American and Caribbean States Held

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- The summit of the Community of Latin American and Caribbean States was held in the capital city of Venezuela on Dec. 2 and 3.
					
					Present there were heads of state and government delegates of 33 countries of the region.
					
					The creation of the community was formally proclaimed at the summit.
					
					The participants discussed the issue of arresting the interference of the dominationist forces and achieving the independent development and unity of the region, the issue of enhancing the influence of the regional countries in the international arena, etc.
					
					22 documents were approved at the summit.

articles.title: PNA Censures Israeli Army for Inhuman Act
articles.content:
PNA Censures Israeli Army for Inhuman Act

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- The Palestinian National Authority (PNA) on Saturday condemned what came in the video showing Israeli soldiers humiliating two Palestinians they had just detained.
					
					"We strongly condemn what came in the video," said Ghassan al- Khatib, spokesman for the Palestinian government in the West Bank. 
					
					The video clip was first aired by Israel's Channel 2 Friday evening. It shows soldiers humiliating two blindfolded youths who were arrested at a West Bank checkpoint. 
					
					"This unfortunately expresses a daily routine in which Palestinian people (are) insulted by the occupation army or settlers," Al-Khatib said.  He hoped the video could help spark international condemnation and pressure on Israel to end the way it treats Palestinians in the West Bank.

articles.title: ISAF Armymen Killed in Eastern Afghanistan
articles.content:
ISAF Armymen Killed in Eastern Afghanistan

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- Three NATO-led International Security Assistance Force (ISAF) service members were killed in an improvised explosive device attack in eastern Afghanistan on Saturday.
					
					The fatalities of NATO-led forces this year, according to Casualties, have been registered at 542 so far.

articles.title: Drought in Mexico
articles.content:
Drought in Mexico

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- Harsh drought hit Mexico recently.
					
					Owing to the drought, worst in 70 years, many crops withered away and 1.7 million domestic animals died.
					
					Five states in northern part of the country suffered great damage.
					
					The government is taking emergency measures including supply of water and food to the afflicted areas.

articles.title: Demonstrations against Capitalism Go on in U.S.
articles.content:
Demonstrations against Capitalism Go on in U.S.

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- Demonstrations against capitalism are going on in the U.S.
					
					Hundreds of demonstrators staged a strike in a park of Portland on Dec. 3. They shouted "This is a peaceful protest! We have the right to assemble!" 
					
					The police arrested more than ten demonstrators.

articles.title: Radioactive Substances Detected in Japan
articles.content:
Radioactive Substances Detected in Japan

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- A lot of contaminated water of high concentration containing radioactive substances leaked from the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant in Japan, sparking off great concern.
					
					The 45 tonnes of contaminated water leaked from the crevice of the outer wall, said the Tokyo Electric Power Co. on December 5.
					
					Contained in it were strontium of one million times the standard level and radioactive cesium of 300 times over.
					
					It is presumed that the water had already flown into the sea far into the north and west Pacific Ocean.
					
					TEPCO admitted that this accident is the worst one.

articles.title: Economic Depression in Japan, Ireland
articles.content:
Economic Depression in Japan, Ireland

					Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- Capital spending by Japanese companies declined 9.8 percent in the three months through September, the Finance Ministry said Friday.
					
					Irish car sales in November dropped by almost half year on year, according to latest figures released on Friday.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il presencia funcion de militares de companias
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il presencia funcion de militares de companias

					Pyongyang, 7 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, presencio la funcion de los militares de las companias adscritas a las Unidades 762, 966, 630, 337 y 233 del EPC que resultaron clasificadas para el 35o Festival Artistico de Militares del EPC.
					
					Los ejecutantes llevaron a la escena la recitacion de poesia "Recuerdo del carro de campana del General", la narracion y coro "Cantemos el carino paternal", el solo de armonica "Camion-cocina", el drama corto "Casa natal del soldado", el concierto de flautas de sauce "Patria recordara eternamente", la poesia y relato "En el antiguo campo de batalla", la poesia en dialogo "El General y nuestra compania Sorikot", el monologo "La etiqueta y moral del militar", el quinteto instrumental "Soy muchacha militar de la epoca del Songun", la narracion y cancion "Nuestro ejercito y nuestro pueblo", el coro "Las fuerzas armadas del monte Paektu responderan" y otras piezas.
					
					La funcion demostro claramente la decision resuelta de los uniformados del EPC de defender a costa de la vida al Lider y convertirse en bombas y balas para salvaguardar la patria socialista.
					
					El Comandante Supremo se mostro muy satisfecho de que los uniformados de las companias hayan ofrecido esta magnifica funcion que refleja el espiritu revolucionario de los militares y les dio el agradecimiento especial del Comandante Supremo del EPC.
					
					La califico de la funcion de fuerte caracter ideologico que muestra el temperamento fundamental de nuestro ejercito y de la funcion perfecta que da ganas de ver diariamente.
					
					Subrayo que deben premiar a los ejecutantes para que ellos puedan enorgullecerse a sus padres en tierra natal.
					
					La presente funcion de los uniformados de las companias seleccionadas en el 35o Festival Artistico de Militares del EPC es sobresaliente de entre las funciones efectuadas hasta ahora, senalo y dio su agradecimiento a los funcionarios que ayudan bien el trabajo cultural entre los uniformados y agrego que deben galardonarlos.
					
					Destaco que la presente funcion comprobo una vez mas que el valor del arte no reside solo en las habilidades elevadas sino tambien en su influencia y su estimulacion ideologica entre las masas. 
					
					Dijo que los uniformados del EPC se han preparado tanto en lo ideo-politico como en lo tecnico-militar y crecido como fuertes en la idea y el credo con la firme preparacion cultural y anadio que gracias a las fuerzas armadas con la firme ideologia, es inexpugnable nuestra patria socialista.
					
					Kim Jong Il se fotografio junto a los militares de las companias participantes en el Festival.
					
					Le acompanaron en verla los funcionarios directivos de los organos del partido y las fuerzas armadas: Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Yong Chun, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, U Tong Chuk y Ri Myong Su, los generales de ejercito del EPC: Kim Myong Guk, Kim Won Hong, Pak Jae Gyong, Ri Pyong Chol, Yun Jong Rin y Hyon Chol Hae, los funcionarios del CC del PTC, los oficiales y soldados del EPC y los funcionarios de sectores de literatura y arte, prensa e informacion.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim recorre Complejo de Acero Chollima
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim recorre Complejo de Acero Chollima

					Pyongyang, 7 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim se entero el dia 6 de la labor del Complejo de Acero Chollima.
					
					Tras entender del estado de produccion de Acero Juche de la Fundicion de Hierro de Posan, recorrio varios talleres del complejo y convoco una reunion consultiva de los funcionarios de la rama correspondiente.
					
					En la ocasion se discutieron las medidas practicas para normalizar la produccion de materiales de hierro y acero y suministrar a tiempo las materias primas y materiales necesarios al incrementar decisivamente la produccion de acero en acato al auge de Hamnam.
					
					El mismo dia, Choe recorrio los procesos de produccion y los depositos de patatas de la Fabrica de Procesamiento de Patatas de Rangnang, recien reconstruida, donde tomo las medidas para normalizar la produccion.

articles.title: Celebran el dia mundial de discapacitados
articles.content:
Celebran el dia mundial de discapacitados

					Pyongyang, 7 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Segun las medidas populares del gobierno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, se realizan dinamicamente varias actividades para ayudar y proteger a los discapacitados, dijo Kim Mun Chol (43 anos de edad), vicepresidente del Comite Central de la Federacion de Proteccion a los Discapacitados de Corea, en exclusiva con la ACNC concedida con motivo del dia mundial de discapacitados (3 de diciembre).
					
					En los ultimos anos, se lograron exitos en las labores para la rehabilitacion mental y fisica de los discapacitados y para asegurar sus posiciones sociales, senalo el y continuo:
					
					Se promueven los proyectos para reconstruir y reparar los sanatorios, equipar con los aparatos de rehabilitacion a los organos de asistencia medica y aplicar ultramodernas tecnicas.
					
					Se activa el servicio de modernos aparatos ortopedicos y se mejora la base material y tecnica de la educacion de la poblacion invalida.
					
					Se presta atencion a la vida cultural de ellos a traves de actividades deportivas y artisticas.
					
					Hace poco, tuvo lugar el torneo de tenis de mesa de los discapacitados de la ciudad de Pyongyang con la participacion de mas de 70 jugadores invalidos y numerosos aficionados.
					
					El Estado hizo organizar el evento en el Palacio de Deportes de Pyongyang que suele ser la sede de muchos competencias internacionales y nacionales.
					
					El torneo de ping pong dejo muy impresionados a los espectadores quienes dijeron que las competencias de ese tipo haran profundizar la concepcion social sobre los invalidos.
					
					Nuestra federacion planea instaurar los grupos de discapacitados calificados para que ellos puedan trabajar por la sociedad y la colectividad.

articles.title: Fluida agua contaminada por radiacion en Japon
articles.content:
Fluida agua contaminada por radiacion en Japon

					Pyongyang, 7 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Fue fluida gran cantidad de agua contaminada por sustancias radiactivas de alta densidad de la planta nuclear de Fukushima, lo que provoca gran problema.
					
					La TEPCO aclaro el dia 5 que 45 toneladas de agua contaminada fugaron a traves de la grieta de una pared exterior.
					
					El agua esta contaminada por strontium equivalente a un millon veces mas que el nivel normal y cesio radiactivo de mas de 300 veces.
					
					Se preve que el agua contaminada ya haya fluido al mar y expandido hasta el Pacifico Noroeste.
					
					La compania reconocio que el presente accidente es el mas serio de entre los flujos ocurridos en la planta hasta la fecha.
